009package Ch08_Binary_Regions;
010
011import ij.IJ;
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
014import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
015import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
016import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.moments.FlusserMoments;
018import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
019import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
020import imagingbook.common.math.Statistics;
021import imagingbook.common.regions.BinaryRegion;
022import imagingbook.common.regions.BinaryRegionSegmentation;
023import imagingbook.common.regions.RegionContourSegmentation;
024import imagingbook.core.resource.ImageResource;
025import imagingbook.sampleimages.kimia.Kimia1070;
026import imagingbook.sampleimages.kimia.Kimia216;
027import imagingbook.sampleimages.kimia.Kimia99;
028
029import java.util.ArrayList;
030import java.util.List;
031
032/**
033 * <p>
034 * This ImageJ plugin calculates the covariance matrix for the 11-element Flusser moment vectors over a collection of
035 * binary images. The plugin assumes binary images (with 0 background and non-zero foreground) and calculates the 11
036 * scale and rotation invariant Flusser moments (sec. G.3 of [1] for details) for the largest contained region contained
037 * in each image of the data set . The resulting covariance matrix is output in {@code float} and bit-encoded
038 * {@code long} format to avoid precision loss. The latter can be converted to {@code double} using
039 * {@link Matrix#fromLongBits(long[][])}. The covariance matrix is used as a parameter to the Mahalanobis distance for
040 * matching moment vectors (see {@link Flusser_Moments_Matching_Demo}).
041 * </p>
042 * <p>
043 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
044 * (2022).
045 * </p>
046 *
047 * @author WB
048 * @version 2022/12/28
049 * @see Flusser_Moments_Matching_Demo
050 */
051public class Flusser_Moments_Covariance_Matrix implements PlugIn {
052
053        private enum DataSet {
054                Kimia99, Kimia216, Kimia1070
055        }
056
057        private static DataSet DATA_SET = DataSet.Kimia99;
058        private static int MIN_REGION_SIZE = 50;
059        private static boolean LIST_LONG_ENCODED_MATRIX = false;
060
061        public void run(String arg0) {
062                if (!runDialog())
063                        return;
064
065                Class<? extends ImageResource> clazz = null;
066                switch(DATA_SET) {
067                        case Kimia99:           clazz = Kimia99.class; break;
068                        case Kimia216:          clazz = Kimia216.class; break;
069                        case Kimia1070:         clazz = Kimia1070.class; break;
070                }
071
072                ImageResource[] irs = clazz.getEnumConstants();
073                IJ.log("Processing " + clazz.getSimpleName() + " dataset (" + irs.length + " images)");
074
075                // moment vectors
076                List<double[]> samples = new ArrayList<double[]>();
077
078                for (int i = 0; i < irs.length; i++) {
079                        ImageResource ir = irs[i];
080                        ImagePlus img = ir.getImagePlus();
081                        if (img == null) {
082                                IJ.log("ERROR: could not open " + ir);
083                                continue;
084                        }
085                        ImageProcessor ip = img.getProcessor(); // do some processing
086                        if (!(ip instanceof ByteProcessor)) {
087                                IJ.log("ERROR: Wrong image type: " + ir);
088                                continue;
089                        }
090
091                        BinaryRegionSegmentation segmenter = new RegionContourSegmentation((ByteProcessor) ip);
092                        List<BinaryRegion> regions = segmenter.getRegions(true);
093                        if (!regions.isEmpty()) {
094                                BinaryRegion r = regions.get(0);
095                                if (r.getSize() >= MIN_REGION_SIZE) {
096                                        double[] moments = new FlusserMoments(r).getInvariantMoments();
097                                        if (!isFinite(moments)) {
098                                                IJ.log("ERROR: non-finite moment vector for " + ir + ": " + Matrix.toString(moments));
099                                        }
100                                        else {
101                                                samples.add(moments);
102                                        }
103                                }
104                        }
105                }
106
107                double[][] samplesA = samples.toArray(new double[0][]);
108                double[][] cov = Statistics.covarianceMatrix(samplesA);
109
110                PrintPrecision.set(9);
111                IJ.log("covariance matrix (double):\n" + Matrix.toString(cov));
112
113                if ( LIST_LONG_ENCODED_MATRIX) {
114                        IJ.log("covariance matrix (long):\n" + Matrix.toString(Matrix.toLongBits(cov)));
115                }
116        }
117
118        private boolean isFinite(double[] moments) {
119                for (int i = 0; i < moments.length; i++) {
120                        if (Double.isFinite(moments[i])) {
121                                return true;
122                        }
123                }
124                return false;
125        }
126
127        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
128
129        private boolean runDialog() {
130                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
131                gd.addEnumChoice("Data set to use", DATA_SET);
132                gd.addNumericField("Minimum region size (pixels)", MIN_REGION_SIZE);
133                gd.addCheckbox("List long-encoded covariance matrix", LIST_LONG_ENCODED_MATRIX);
134
135                gd.showDialog();
136                if (gd.wasCanceled()) {
137                        return false;
138                }
139
140                DATA_SET = gd.getNextEnumChoice(DataSet.class);
141                MIN_REGION_SIZE = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
142                LIST_LONG_ENCODED_MATRIX = gd.getNextBoolean();
143                return true;
144        }
145
146}
147
